title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for 0 as x → −∞

1 point is earned for ∞ or DNE as x → ∞

lim x→−∞ 2x e 2x =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47AA@

lim x→∞ 2x e 2x =∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4774@ or DNE
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for 0 as x → −∞

1 point is earned for ∞ or DNE as x → ∞

lim x→−∞ 2x e 2x =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47AA@

lim x→∞ 2x e 2x =∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4774@ or DNE

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for 0 as x → −∞

1 point is earned for ∞ or DNE as x → ∞

lim x→−∞ 2x e 2x =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47AA@

lim x→∞ 2x e 2x =∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4774@ or DNE

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for 0 as x → −∞

1 point is earned for ∞ or DNE as x → ∞

lim x→−∞ 2x e 2x =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47AA@

lim x→∞ 2x e 2x =∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4774@ or DNE

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if solves f'(x) = 0

1 point is earned if evaluates f at student’s critical point

0/1 if not local minimum from student’s derivative

1 point is earned if justifies absolute minimum value

0/1 for a local argument

0/1 without explicit symbolic derivative

Note: 0/3 if no absolute minimum based on student’s derivative

f ′ (x)=2 e 2x +2x⋅2⋅ e 2x =2 e 2x (1+2x)=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@56B5@

if x = −1/2

f(−1/2) = −1/e or −0.368 or −0.367

−1/e is an absolute minimum value because:

(i) f'(x) < 0 for all x < −1/2 and f'(x) > 0 for all x > −1/2

-or-

(ii)

and x = −1/2 is the only critical number

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

Note: must include the left–hand endpoint; exclude the right–hand “endpoint”

Range of f = [−1/e, ∞) or [−0.367, ∞) or [−0.368, ∞)
descriptions:

1 point is earned for the answer

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if sets y ′ =b e bx (1+bx)=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4592@

1 point is earned for solving student’s y' = 0

1 point is earned if evaluates y at a critical number and gets a value independent of b

Note: 0/3 if only considering specific values of b

y ′ =b e bx + b 2 x e bx =b e bx (1+bx)=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5142@

if x = −1/b

At x = −1/b, y = −1/e

y has an absolute minimum value of −1/e for all nonzero b
